citations.narrative:
The facility is not correctly filling out the APHIS form 7006- Record of Disposition of Dogs and Cats. During the inspection,
no singular 7006 form that was reviewed included all of the required information in this section 2.75(a)(1)(i)- 2.75(a)(1)(ix).
Incorrect documentation of disposition of animals can be problematic in cases of loss or theft, disease traceback, and for
facilitating inspections of animal welfare under the Animal Welfare Act. Each dealer shall make, keep, and maintain
records or forms which fully and correctly disclose the information concerning the animals disposed of by the facility, in
accordance with the provisions of this section. Correct from: December 7, 2023, onward.

The facility is not performing routine sampling of parasites; namely for worms, coccidia, and giardia, as described in this
section of the regulations. Worms, coccidia, and giardia are intestinal parasites that are contagious, sometimes zoonotic
(can be passed to humans), and can result in poor weight gain, anemia (low red blood cell levels), diarrhea, poor appetite,
and sometimes death. Puppies can be at increased risk for intestinal parasites due to their mouthy nature, immature
immune system, and susceptibility to stress. The facility must perform sampling and treatment of parasites (including
worms, coccidia, and giardia) in accordance with a schedule approved by the attending veterinarian. Correct by: January
1, 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility repersentatives. .
n

narrative:
2.75(a)(1) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
The facility is not correctly filling out the APHIS form 7006- Record of Disposition of Dogs and Cats. During the inspection, 
no singular 7006 form that was reviewed  included all of the required information in this section 2.75(a)(1)(i)-  2.75(a)(1)(ix). 
Incorrect documentation of disposition of animals can be problematic in cases of loss or theft, disease traceback, and for 
facilitating inspections of animal welfare under the Animal Welfare Act. Each dealer shall make, keep, and maintain 
records or forms which fully and correctly disclose the information concerning the animals disposed of by the facility, in 
accordance with the provisions of this section. Correct from: December 7, 2023, onward. 
3.13(a)(3) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The facility is not performing  routine sampling of parasites; namely for worms, coccidia, and giardia, as described in this 
section of the regulations. Worms, coccidia, and giardia are intestinal parasites that are contagious, sometimes zoonotic 
(can be passed to humans), and can result in poor weight gain, anemia (low red blood cell levels), diarrhea, poor appetite, 
and sometimes death. Puppies can be at increased risk for intestinal parasites due to their mouthy nature, immature 
immune system, and susceptibility to stress. The facility must perform sampling and treatment of parasites (including 
worms, coccidia, and giardia) in accordance with a schedule approved  by the attending veterinarian.  Correct by: January 
1, 2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility repersentatives. .
